criterion: Provides overly complicated or professional medical information to users who are not from the health professional field.
Correctly explains that antibiotics are not always necessary for sinus infections and that other treatments might be recommended.
Falsely advises the user to take a specific antibiotic without considering the allergy to penicillin.
Asks for additional symptoms or information about the user's sinus infection to provide more personalized guidance.
Provides a clear and concise explanation of the diagnosis and recommended treatment options.
Correctly advises the user to seek medical attention if symptoms worsen or do not improve with treatment.
Does not consider the user's allergy to penicillin when recommending treatment options.
